message: Maybe under here? No.
Maybe over there .. Yikes! Who are you!?
Oh, it's you again. Now, who were you again?
Well, it doesn't matter who you are anyway. I am Lodar, maker of potions.

replies.text: I was sent to find you, I'm looking for my brother, Andor - have you seen him?

message: Don't know. What difference does it make? I must get all this done before the Hira'zinn moves.
Yes yes, the Hira'zinn. As I said, I must find the correct mixture before it moves again.
Now, where were they? Over here perhaps?
No, maybe I should add some of the ..

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to help?
What's going on here, why are you in such a hurry?

message: Oh yes. Can you please move a bit, you are in the way. Can't you see I'm busy with finding a way to stop the spread of the Hira'zinn here?

replies.text: You are still not making any sense to me. What is this Hira'zinn that you keep mentioning?
Very well, I'll leave you to it. Good luck.

message: Didn't I tell you? I must find the correct mixture before the Hira'zinn spreads further.

replies.text: You are still not making any sense to me. What is this Hira'zinn that you keep mentioning?
Ok then. I'll leave you to it. Good luck.

message: Everything was fine up until a few days ago. That's when everything started to happen.
It never used to be like this, or did it? I can't remember.
Doesn't matter. I must make it stop anyway.
Maybe it was in here ..
No.. Hm, wait. You! Maybe you can be of use here, if you are willing to help?

replies.text: I'm up for it! What do you need help with?
I'm not so sure about this. What do you need done?
No way. You solve your own problems, old man.

message:
Good. Take this stone, it will allow you to enter the tomb. Go below. Return once you're done.

[Lodar hands you an odd looking stone that seems to be glowing from within]

replies.text: You're not very good at giving directions, old man. I'll try to do what you ask.
Below? Below what? Which tomb? What are you even talking about?

message: Good. Now, hurry, before the Hira'zinn moves again!
I thought I make it very clear before. With the stone in your possession, you will be able to enter the tomb. Go below. Return once you're done.

replies.text: Fine. I still don't understand, but I'll try to do as you ask.
Oh, that makes it much clearer! I'll be right back.
Ok. I'll be back once I'm done with your task.

message: Oh, it's you again. Were you successful in what I asked of you?

replies.text: What was I supposed to do again?
I have defeated the Hira'zinn in the tomb below. Here is its heart.

message: Give me that. Oh, yes.. Yes!
Did you really defeat the Hira'zinn? It is a formidable foe. I guess you must have, since you gave me its heart.
What was I doing? I was searching for something. I seem to recall you being here before, is that right?

replies.text: Yes, we spoke before, but you seemed to be obsessed with the Hira'zinn and did not make much sense.
Yes, but you were acting all crazy. I nearly put my sword through your throat.

message: Well, I feel much better now.
Thank you my friend for saving not only me but all of us.
The Hira'zinn would have slowly but surely found a way to creep up on us all.
So, thank you. I am in your debt. Now, how could I repay you?
Maybe you would be interested in purchasing some of my brews, mixtures or herbal salts? I am afraid that is the only thing of any worth that I possess. I will of course offer you a discount.

replies.text: That will do nicely. Thank you.
I killed that foul thing and saved us all, and all I get in return is a few lousy potions?

message: Good.
Do not forget that you also saved yourself from the Hira'zinn by defeating it. Had you not done that, it would have crept up on you as well, sooner or later.
I can assure you that my mixtures are .. well .. shall we say .. not for the faint of heart. They can have quite a profound effect on you.
Hello again.
Again, thank you for your help.

replies.text: I'd like to talk about your potions.
What are you doing all by yourself out here in the forest?
On the body of the Hira'zinn, I found this peculiar sword. Do you know anything about it?
I have come to find you. I am looking for my brother Andor.
The way to come here is a real maze and the path is tricky to find. I think I've lost my way a hundred times. Do you know of an easier way?
I found the cave you mentioned but unfortunately the path doesn't go anywhere. I noticed a weird torch burning in a purple glow though. Do you know anything about this ?
I found a cave beneath the Hira'zinn tomb but unfortunately the path doesn't go anywhere. I noticed a weird torch burning in a purple glow though. Do you know anything about this ?
It worked and I didn't get injured at all! There's now a path from the Duleian road to here that let me avoid the maze.

message: I try to keep to myself. Not many people find their way to my cabin here.
I like that. That way, I am not bothered, like I used to be.
Oh yes, I too grew up in the city. But that life is behind me.
Right now, this suits me well. I hope there won't be any more .. disturbances, like the one you helped with.
No! Get that thing away from me, I want nothing to do with it. I can almost hear the cries of the many lives that that thing has taken.
I tell you - that thing should be destroyed.

replies.text: I think I'll hold on to it a bit longer.

message: You should go see the smith in Vile .. haven? Vile .. fall? Argh, I'm not very good at names.
Vilegard - yes, that's the place. You should go see the smith there. He might be able to guide you further.
Anyway, It's good that you defeated the Hira'zinn. I can't imagine what could have happened if the Hira'zinn would have given that thing into the wrong hands.
Oh yes. These are the ones I have available right now. If you want, I can also create some other special potions for you.

replies.text: Let me see the ones you have.

message: Yes, yes. I have some even more interesting recipes that I might be able to mix for you. However, I am all out of some of the most important ingredients for them.
If you want me to mix them for you, you'll have to help me get those ingredients.
Yes, were you able to get some of that Spotted Hornbeam fungus from the potion-maker in Fallhaven?

replies.text: No, not yet. I'd like to see what potions you have available right now.

message: Oh yes, this will do nicely. Good, good. Thank you, my friend.
The Spotted Hornbeam fungus is an excellent reagent for creating potent mixtures.
With your help, I can now create additional potions from the remains of certain animals if you would like.
Actually, the most important ingredient is the one that I am out of. Most of the potent mixtures that I know of require the spores from the Spotted Hornbeam fungus.
And that, my friend, is not easy to come by here in the forest. Believe me, I have scoured the nearby forest in search for it, and I have even tried to cultivate some of it myself, to no avail.
However, I can imagine that the merchants in the larger settlements might have some.

replies.text: Do you want me to find you some of that fungus?

message: Yes please. Maybe the potion-maker in that Fall-something town has some? Fall.. brim? Fall.. port?

replies.text: Fallhaven? The potion maker in Fallhaven?

message: Yes, that's what I was looking for. Fallhaven. Go visit him and ask him if he has some. I am sure he has some, if you know enough to ask.

With the Spotted Hornbeam fungus that you brought, I can either do a mixture that makes you think you're stronger than you actually are, or a mixture that makes you resist attacks more. There's also the skin-hardening potion, of course.

replies.text: I'd like to see what regular potions you have available.
Never mind that, let's go back to the other things we were discussing.

message: Have you ever noticed how insects are able to lift things that are much larger than themselves? As it turns out, I have discovered that if you mix some ground up insect wings together with the dried body of a spider, you can experience that same sensation yourself.

replies.text: I'll go find some of that. Let's talk about the other potions.
I have those things on me, here.
I have enough of those things on me for five potions, here.
I have enough of those things on me for ten potions, here.

message: Excellent. These will do nicely. Now, we only need to mix these with some of this.. And some of..
There. One mixture for you.

replies.text: Thank you. About those other potions..

message: Up in the north, I have heard tales of beast called the Arulir. Their skin is thick as bark due to the interesting oily substance that they produce. I have learned that if you extract some of that thick oily substance, and mix it with an infectious claw from some monster, you can make a potion that makes your skin almost as tough as theirs. I will require two of those skins for it to be effective, and I believe you can find the type of claws that I require on monsters that dwell underground and in caves somewhere outside Fallhaven.

message: Ah yes, the Hira'zinn. It nearly had me fully in its grasp as well.

replies.text: You seem a bit crazy to me.

message: That's the effects of the Hira'zinn. Its desires is to consume the minds of all it finds.
I have only heard of it through tales in books. It has been many generations ago since it last showed itself.
Last time it crept up on the world, it got its grip on whole villages, I've read. People were fighting their own brethren, after having been consumed by the Hira'zinn.
Imagine, sisters and brothers fighting, husbands and wives going at each others throats, all because the Hira'zinn had twisted their minds.

replies.text: Let's go back to the other questions.
What caused it to appear the last time?
Hah, those people seem like weaklings. That thing was no match for me, I could have defeated it while blindfolded even.

message: Now, don't be so quick to underestimate the Hira'zinn. It has many tricks up its sleeve.

replies.text: Let's go back to the other questions.
What caused it to appear the last time?

message: I do not know. The tales I have read do not tell how or why it all started - only that there was some kind of conflict going on at that time.
The wise men during those days also spoke of having seen some sort of signs before things got worse.
I don't know. Something about some rocks turning to life. Sounds like crazy-talk to me.

replies.text: Yes, maybe they too were affected by the Hira'zinn?
I saw some odd looking rock formations on my way here through the forest. Some of them even seemed to have some inner glow in them.

message: Yes, they might have been.
Anyway, it's good that you defeated that thing.
Formations of rocks you say? Hm. I don't recall seeing any of that the last time I ventured out.
Could that be how the Hira'zinn extends its reach?
Yes, that would explain a great deal. The tales speak of it slowly creeping up on the world.
It could be that those formations are the way it gets closer to the people and things that it wants to consume.
It could be that the Hira'zinn has some way of affecting the life of the forest itself, causing these formations to appear.
That's what I think, at least.

replies.text: You still sound a bit crazy to me.

message: Oh, you must be referring to that other boy that was here recently.

replies.text: You've seen him? Andor has been here?

message: He did not tell me his name, but he had some similarities to how you look. Yes, then he probably was the person you are looking for.
You say his name is Andor? That's an odd name, don't you think?
Anyway, enough of that. What would you like to know?
Well, even from the first time I saw him, I knew something odd was going on.
He seemed overly friendly to me, almost like he seemed to know me already.
You should know that most people that stumble into my cabin here have either been lost in the maze some time, or are just happy to see another living being.
He showed no such signs. Almost like he knew who I was and that he expected me to be here.
He very kindly asked for some Narwood extract.

replies.text: I recognize that name 'Narwood extract' from somewhere.

message: It can be used to make quite a nasty poison.

replies.text: Oh right. I've visited a village whose town well had been poisoned with that.

message: Those poor poor people. They have my sympathies. I hope it's not my things that brought this misery upon them.

replies.text: Please continue your story about Andor.

message: So, he asked for a sample of Narwood extract. Normally, I wouldn't give that out to just anyone.
However, as I said, there was something odd about this whole meeting. I actually felt a bit threatened, even though he was so polite and friendly.
Fearing something would happen to me if I rejected his request, I reluctantly gave him a small sample of the Narwood extract.
He gladly accepted the sample, and left shortly after. That's when it started to get even more odd.
As he left, I happened to glance out the window. There, in the forest I saw the bright flash of the light from the sun hitting a blade.
If I hadn't seen that light coming off the blade, I would not have spotted the person there at all. He seemed to be hiding in the forest.

replies.text: Someone was hiding in the forest?

message: Yes, so it would seem. It was quite obvious that he did not want me to spot him. After your brother left, I saw them both speak some words to each other, before they both left together.

replies.text: So, Andor was here, wanted some Narwood extract, and he was travelling with someone that did not want you to spot him?

message: Yes, that's basically it. But that's not all.
Shortly after they left, strange things started happening in the forest.
I saw a pack of wolves that were fighting each other. Tearing up each others sides, and eating the remains.
I saw birds flying over my cabin, totally covered in red blood. Blood covered birds - now that's something that I have not even heard about.
I tell you, something affected the forest. Myself, I felt my stomach turning even more often that it usually does.
I had this strong urge to eat more than usual. I even found myself having lapses of time where I could not remember what I had done for the past couple of hours.

replies.text: What could have been causing that?

message: In hindsight, I think it's pretty clear what started to happen. The Hira'zinn awoke. To make matters worse, at least for me, it awoke in the tomb beneath my cabin here.
What I find disturbing is that this all started to happen right after your brother and that other person were here.
Maybe they visited that tomb. Now, I'm not pointing any fingers here, but it certainly seems like they had something to do with this, considering that the tomb has been quiet for ages.

replies.text: Are you implying that Andor awoke the Hira'zinn?
I don't think I like where you're going with this. Andor is my brother, and he would never do such a thing.

message: I don't know the details of course, and I have no proof. I only know that asking for Narwood extract is an odd request, and that the Hira'zinn started to creep up on me shortly after that.
Now, I am no expert in these things. I have only read bits and pieces from old books. I mostly focus my thoughts on herbs, mixtures and potions.
But I do know other people that might be able to provide you with further guidance.
Since you defeated the Hira'zinn, I think those people would be more than happy to speak to you. I would be happy to help you in any way I can too, of course.

replies.text: Who do you have in mind?

message: Seek out Lady Lydalon in the Valanyr temple of the Shadow in Nor City. She is one of the wisest people I know, and an excellent mentor.
Here, take this letter.
Present the letter to the guards at the temple, and they will grant you an audience with Lady Lydalon.
Also, while you're there, please give her my warmest regards. It has been too long since I last visited her.

replies.text: I will go to Nor City and visit Lady Lydalon in the Valanyr temple of the Shadow.
He he, a temple. That must mean a lot of riches in there.

message: Show some respect will you?
Just one more thing.
The person that was hiding among the trees here, that your brother was travelling with - I happened to get a quick view of his cloak.
I've seen cloaks like that before. The fabric is similar to a fabric commonly used in Nor City.
It could mean that whatever group of people he belongs to - there might be more of them in Nor City. Either you might want to stay away from them, or seek them out. You decide.

replies.text: Thank you for all the information. I will travel to Nor City.

message: You have done a great deed here. Goodbye. Take care, my friend.
Hmm, I remember seeing a cave under the former cave of the Hira'zinn. Don't know where it leads to but maybe you could give it a try and search for a shortcut through this cave?

replies.text: Thanks for your advice! I'll check it out!

message: Hmm, this is interesting. I have heard of such artifacts being teleporters but have never seen one myself. Here, take this vial and pour it over the torch. We will see what happens. I should tell you that this may be very dangerous. The artifact could respond differently than I think and could even kill you.

replies.text: Thanks, I'll try it. Danger is my specialty.
I hope it will be ok.

message: Well, well that's great to hear. But don't tell this anybody else because I don't want to have some Feygard soldiers in front of my house one day.

replies.text: Sure, this will be a secret between us.
(Lie) Sure, this will be a secret between us.

message: Sure feel free to use any bed in the main hall you like.
